com.yworks.yfiles.layout

Class GraphLayoutLineWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.AbstractLayoutStage
      • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.GraphLayoutLineWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILayoutAlgorithm, ILayoutStage

    public class GraphLayoutLineWrapper
extends AbstractLayoutStage
    GraphLayoutLineWrapper can line-wrap or column-wrap a graph layout.

    This ILayoutStage supports both wrapping a layout at a given width (height) and wrapping a layout automatically at some width (height) such that the resulting overall aspect ratio is close to a desired target ratio.

    The GraphLayoutLineWrapper can be used on an existing graph layout or on the result of the core layout algorithm.

      Creates a new GraphLayoutLineWrapper instance with default settings.

    • Method Detail

      • applyLayout

        public void applyLayout(LayoutGraph graph)
        Cuts the layout resulting from the core layout algorithm at a specified width/height and shifts the remaining graph into the next row/column until the layout has the desired width/height.
        Specified by:
        applyLayout in interface ILayoutAlgorithm
        Specified by:
        applyLayout in class AbstractLayoutStage
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph

      • getEdgeSpacing

        public double getEdgeSpacing()
        Gets the space that should be kept between edges.

        The spacing must be non-negative.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given spacing is a negative value
        Default Value:
        The default value is 5.
        Returns:
        the space between edges
        See Also:
        setEdgeSpacing(double)

      • getFixedWidth

        public double getFixedWidth()
        Gets the desired width of the lines.

        The GraphLayoutLineWrapper breaks the lines at the specified width.

        In column mode, the fixed width is interpreted as fixed height for a column.

         
        The algorithm will not necessarily be able to satisfy very small values, since the nodes need to fit completely into a line.
         
        The specified width is only considered if FixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled returns true.
        Default Value:
        The default value is 500.
        Returns:
        the width of the lines
        See Also:
        setFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled(boolean), setColumnModeEnabled(boolean), setFixedWidth(double)

      • getSpacing

        public double getSpacing()
        Gets the space between adjacent lines of the wrapped graph layout.

        If the column mode is enabled, this spacing defines the distance between adjacent columns.

        The spacing should be non-negative.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the spacing is negative
        Default Value:
        The default value is 10.
        Returns:
        the space between the lines
        See Also:
        setSpacing(double)

      • getTargetRatio

        public double getTargetRatio()
        Gets the desired target aspect ratio for the layout.

        The aspect ratio needs to be greater than 0.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the target ratio is 0 or less
         
        The specified width is only considered if FixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled returns false.
        Default Value:
        The default value is 1.
        Returns:
        the desired target aspect ratio in terms of width/height
        See Also:
        setFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled(boolean), setTargetRatio(double)

      • isColumnModeEnabled

        public boolean isColumnModeEnabled()
        Gets whether this ILayoutStage wraps lines/rows or columns.

        If this mode is enabled, the layout is wrapped vertically and new columns are appended to the right of the first column. Otherwise, the layout is wrapped horizontally and new rows are appended below the first row.

        Also, the FixedWidth property will be interpreted as a fixed height if this mode is enabled.

        Default Value:
        The default value is false. The layout is wrapped horizontally, producing rows.
        Returns:
        true for column wrapping mode, false for row wrapping
        See Also:
        setFixedWidth(double), setColumnModeEnabled(boolean)

      • isFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled

        public boolean isFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled()
        Gets whether the algorithm should use the fixed width or target aspect ratio to determine line breaks.
        Default Value:
        The default value is false. The target aspect ratio defines how the line width is chosen.
        Returns:
        true if a fixed line width is used, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setFixedWidth(double), setTargetRatio(double), setFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled(boolean)

      • isMirrored

        public boolean isMirrored()
        Gets whether or not every other line is mirrored.

        When breaking a line and placing the remaining line below, this remainder can be rotated by 180 degrees. Then, the edges connecting both lines stay short. In case the remainder is not rotated, the edges are routed between the two lines to connect to the front of the non-mirrored line.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. Every other line is mirrored.
        Returns:
        true if every second line is rotated by 180 degrees, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setMirrored(boolean)

      • setColumnModeEnabled

        public void setColumnModeEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets whether this ILayoutStage wraps lines/rows or columns.

        If this mode is enabled, the layout is wrapped vertically and new columns are appended to the right of the first column. Otherwise, the layout is wrapped horizontally and new rows are appended below the first row.

        Also, the FixedWidth property will be interpreted as a fixed height if this mode is enabled.

        Default Value:
        The default value is false. The layout is wrapped horizontally, producing rows.
        Parameters:
        value - true for column wrapping mode, false for row wrapping
        See Also:
        setFixedWidth(double), isColumnModeEnabled()

      • setFixedWidth

        public void setFixedWidth(double value)
        Sets the desired width of the lines.

        The GraphLayoutLineWrapper breaks the lines at the specified width.

        In column mode, the fixed width is interpreted as fixed height for a column.

         
        The algorithm will not necessarily be able to satisfy very small values, since the nodes need to fit completely into a line.
         
        The specified width is only considered if FixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled returns true.
        Default Value:
        The default value is 500.
        Parameters:
        value - the width of the lines
        See Also:
        setFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled(boolean), setColumnModeEnabled(boolean), getFixedWidth()

        public void setFixedWidthLineBreaksEnabled(boolean value)

        Default Value:

        Parameters:

        See Also:

        public void setMirrored(boolean value)

        public void setTargetRatio(double value)

        Throws:
